一旦鼠群注意到PC们，这些生物便开始嘶嘶作响、喋喋不休，并兴奋地尖叫，它们成片地附着在洞穴长满真菌的墙壁上。除非PC们先攻击鼠群，否则这些祖格鼠们不会攻击他们；在这种情况下，祖格鼠们愤怒地嚎叫，蜂拥而下袭来，并战斗至死.

如果玩家用邪灵语或通用语说话，鼠群就会立即安静下来，数百只发光的大眼睛会凝视你们片刻。之后祖格鼠群用它们令人不安的方式开口说话，每个词都是由不同的祖格鼠说出来的，但节奏听起来却像是来自同一个声源。它们想知道，是不是PC们的梦把它们从梦境维度心爱的林地中引诱出来的，如果不是，那又是谁的梦。祖格鼠们把这些梦描述成一系列幻象：在巨大的洞穴或峡谷中蔓延着一座巨大的城市；弯弯曲曲的螺旋形街道蜿蜒穿过尖尖的建筑和闪亮的塔楼；奇异的音乐和欢快的笑声在宽阔的大厅中回荡；没有阳光的海岸线拍打着石墩；以及强烈的幸福和快乐的感觉。但吸引他们来到这里的是梦境的“气味”，祖格鼠们将这种气味描述为“珍贵回忆的气味”与“未实现的希望的气味.”

. 如果成功通过@Check[occultism|dc:28|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge]检定，就足以让一名PC认出这段描述可能指的是神秘而传奇的失落之城伊尔瓦兰丁（Ilvarandin）—一个坐落在不知名的峡谷深处，或者深藏在巨大的地下洞穴中的天堂（取决于传说）。大成功可以让PC回忆起更多令人不安的传言，即伊尔瓦兰丁是一座虚假之城，居住着神秘的会变形的生物。大失败则会让PC确信梦境中的城市是古代由瑟西隆的符文领主统治的七座城市之一.

祖格鼠们请求PC们把那个梦带给它们，这样它们就可以回家了，或者，如果没有梦，就把梦到过这座城市的人带给他们。作为酬劳，它们承诺在它们回家时为PC留下一件珍宝。如果PC们给祖格鼠群带来一剂午夜牛奶，其中一个生物很快就会喝下这种药物，而且这种药效不会单独产生在这只祖格鼠上，而是会迅速传遍整个祖格鼠群，让它们高兴地叹息和呻吟片刻，然后就会穿过睡眠的界限消失，返回梦境维度。或者，如果他们带来了一个曾经梦见过伊尔瓦兰丁的人，祖格鼠们会要求那个人立刻睡觉并为他们做梦。如果这个人同意，祖格鼠们当便会围在它身边，等它躺下并进入深度睡眠—一旦入梦者开始做梦，祖格鼠们就会利用这种能量返回家园。梦境就像催化剂一样，像这样被利用的做梦的生物在醒来时可能会感到忧伤和遗憾，因为他们没有能够与祖格鼠群一起旅行。如果入梦者未能通过 @Check[will|dc:23]检定，他们将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]（或在大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}），直到通过魔法解除该状态 .

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.kSMe8WQRJSgvIhIg]{Zoog's Promise}
如果PC们帮助祖格鼠们回家，这些奇异的生物就会兑现他们的承诺。当它们消失的时候，它们留下了曾经提到的宝藏—一根由玄武岩制成的 魅影杀手魔杖 ，魔杖的顶端有一个黑曜石雕刻的无脸石像鬼（Gargoyle），一条细长的尾巴紧紧缠绕在魔杖的长柄上 .

不过，祖格鼠的谢礼不止于此。在接下来的几天里，祖格鼠们会以梦境的形式重访PC们，并承诺会传授PC们一些奇异的秘密。这份礼物可以让PC们在一周内享受到一系列@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y0Vy7iNL3ET8K00C]法术的好处，在此期间，如果他们想利用祖格鼠朋友与他们分享的奇异秘密和建议，他们可以有效地利用休整期进行重训.

Reward: 如果PC们帮助祖格鼠们回家，给予他们相当于在战斗中击败祖格鼠群的XP. combat.

Shadows at Midnight.name: 午夜阴影Shadows at Midnight
Shadows at Midnight.text:
Chapter 5: 午夜阴影

这一层的入口位于大深坑本身的雾线下方。它是里拉菈露在星陨之灾前的最后日子里管理的瑟西隆建筑群中第一个保存完好的建筑。虽然她所指挥的间谍网络主要集中在现已基本被侵蚀的上层，但这一层和下面的层级在很大程度上对她的上司是保密的。莉拉拉露并没有像许多瑟西隆统治者那样依赖巨人建筑师和劳动力，而是大量使用从土元素位面（Elemental Plane Of Earth）召唤来的受束仆役，其中包括几位土巨灵（Shaitan Genie）。有了这些仆人的帮助，在不向那些干涉她计划的人泄露她的工作的情况下，开凿和建造庞大的地下层级就变得轻而易举了.

大深坑的这一层级适合于 7 级PC.

The Cloneworks.name: 克隆工坊 The Cloneworks
The Cloneworks.text:
克隆工坊

里拉菈露隐藏建筑群的每一层都有自己的目的，这一层主要是研究莎拉斯特（Shalast）的南方邻居—符文领主索珊（Sorshen）。特别是，里拉菈露对索珊制造了无数个自己的克隆体，并把它们藏在整个瑟西隆的偏远地区的传言非常着迷，这样一来，如果她死了，她的意识就会在那些隐秘的地下室里的许多备用躯体的其中一个中重生。特别是，里拉菈露对身为欲望魔法（Lust Magic）修炼者的符文领主索珊如何能够掌握@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pZr1xrCpaSu6qrXU]这种强大的死灵系（Necromantic）魔法仪式感到好奇，因为在那个时代，这种魔法流派是那些研究惑控系（Enchantment）魔法的人的禁忌。最终，这个思路让里拉菈露对瑟西隆魔法的本质有了更深的理解，但在克隆工坊，她的研究和调查主要集中在克隆 仪式本身—它是如何运作的，如何用来制造她可以控制的重要政治人物的复制品，以及如何强化和简化仪式，使其不那么难以执行。从理论上讲，仪式本身并不超出里拉菈露实际操作的能力范围。她一直在努力学习仪式，但始终没有完全掌握，直到星陨之灾终止了她的计划，因此克隆工坊从未得到充分利用.

在星陨之灾和里拉菈露神秘失踪之后，她留在这里作为研究员的学徒们放弃了克隆工坊，几千年来，这些房间一直空置。直到五十年前空洞之星（Hollow Star）守护者们的到来，这些大厅里才再次有了生命，除了北面洞穴里的几只令人不安的怪物.

Music NotesMusic

@UUID[Playlist.YHCeMbIzyQ6wPX5j.PlaylistSound.b6oFX4XHQ07olNjT]{Shadows At Midnight (Loop)}, @UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.ju6d3j52uDpPDAFw]{Shadows At Midnight}

Keepers of the Hollow Star.name: 空洞之星的守护者 Keepers of the Hollow Star
Keepers of the Hollow Star.text:
空洞之星的守护者

空洞之星的守护者是一小群癫儒（Dero），他们的祖先发现外神的一个孢子在穿过地壳后被埋藏在一个深洞中，自此他们便开始崇拜@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.sILda7I8Ak20Ioj9]这个实体。这种诡秘的入侵并没有留下一个坑洞，而是像一根热针穿透了苹果的果肉一样刺穿了格拉利昂，将自己埋在了幽暗地域上层纳-沃斯（Nar-Voth）的一个洞穴中，最终，一位癫儒神秘学家发现了它，她是被一连串梦境引诱到这里的，这些梦境预示着天空中太阳的死亡。这位癫儒现在早已去世，但她的幻觉却以一种宗教的形式流传了下来，这个小圈子里的人都信奉这种宗教，他们相信总有一天，他们崇拜的至宝—被他们称为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]的万花筒一样的奇异物质碎片—会“孵化”并升入天空，侵蚀太阳并吞噬它的火焰.

当空洞之星的守护者的领导权落到名叫齐拉迪尼（Ziradini）的癫儒手中时，他做出了一个决定。他认为空洞之星还没有显化是因为在地下太久了，于是他带领所有人穿过隧道，最终来到了这些洞穴中。在发现克隆工坊后，齐拉迪尼开始着迷于用自己族人的肉体制造一种可以承受太阳光的癫儒的可能性，这种癫儒可以把空洞之星带到地面上，这样太阳本身就可以唤醒它，从而使它自己灭亡.

空洞之星守护者的信仰非常极端，对于格拉里昂来说幸运的是，他们的信仰不过是痴迷的幻想，但他们和他们守护的空洞之星仍然相当危险。当提鲁阿切克（Tiluatchek）和“午夜黎明”（Midnight Dawn）第一次从下面的幽暗地域（沿着多年前守护者们走过的相同路线）上来时，他意识到了拥有守护者们作为盟友的价值，于是通过向他们提供额外的魔法物资和从伊尔瓦兰丁（Ilvarandin）图书馆中提取的典籍以帮助他们进行研究，作为回报，他要求守护者们允许“午夜黎明”的特工们不受干扰地进出西边的通道，并在必要时帮助他们抵御敌人的攻击.

虽然守护者们还没有被要求履行他们的约定，但如果他们发现PC们擅自闯入了他们的领地，他们就会迫不及待地这样做.

Cloneworks Features.name: 克隆工坊的特征 Cloneworks Features
Cloneworks Features.text:
克隆工坊的特征

直到不久前，克隆工坊还因@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ynm8JIU3sc3qUMpa]而灯火通明。现在，居住在这里的癫儒砸碎了镶嵌在克隆工坊南部墙壁上的发光石。如今，墙壁上只剩下被砸碎的石槽，除非另有说明，否则房间内都处于黑暗中。房间的天花板平均高度为8尺，大多数房间的天花板高度为12尺。门是石头做的，那些古老的、保存完好的铰链很容易打开。克隆工坊周围的洞穴非常潮湿，细小的水流沿着地面缓缓流淌，最终在区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20}深处汇聚成池.

Chupacabra Den.name: 卓柏卡布拉的巢穴 Chupacabra Den
Chupacabra Den.text:
F1. 卓柏卡布拉的巢穴Low 7

钟乳石和石笋让人难以估计这个狭长岩洞的长度。凝结在墙壁上的水珠在地面上汇聚成水坑，形成一股涓涓细流缓慢流向西南方的隧道。在东南方，腐肉的臭味就像某种恐怖的征兆一样弥漫开来.

虽然钟乳石和石笋使得判断这个洞穴的形状变得困难，但它们并不会显著影响移动，除非在一个方格中出现多个，这种情况下该方格将变为困难地形。PC可以使用一个交互动作在其方格内的石笋后面获得掩蔽.

Chupacabra's Den Low 7

@UUID[Actor.1yI2pitvuQkpOCBd]{False Devil}

Creature:除了上面那层的夏塔克鸟，这个岩洞的主人也是最近沙尖镇魔鬼目击事件的最大来源—一个比大多数人都高的会飞的卓柏卡布拉（Chupacabra）。哨牙地精将野生动物和定期抓来的牲畜扔进大深坑，作为沙尖镇魔鬼的祭品，这些动物和牲畜掉落在区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20003whistl.JournalEntryPage.03foggyledge0000]{C4b}的岩架上，成为卓柏卡布拉的盘中餐。当洞穴中出现真正的入侵者时，它的反应非常惊讶，并发出威胁性的嘶嘶声.它不会立即发动攻击，因为它不确定来访者是否是它的食物来源，但如果PC们在被发现后的一轮内没有离开，这只饥饿的生物就会认为他们是食物并向他们扑去。它誓死捍卫自己的领地，虽然它不会追赶进入洞穴深处的玩家，但如果他们往大深坑方向逃跑，它肯定会追到大深坑中并爬上岩壁.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.uCE2oOagFvZbzbeE]{Nest of Bones and Moldy Shrubbery}
卓柏卡布拉在洞穴的东南部有一个由骨头和发霉灌木组成的大巢穴。对巢穴进行搜索后很快就会发现，野生动物和牲畜并不是它唯一的食物，因为在这里众多的骨头中，躺着十几具从失落海岸大道（Lost Coast Road）上被掳走的类人生物尸体，这些尸体是在过去几年的不同时间被掳来的。其中一具是冒险者的尸体，遗体上还穿着一套+1暗影镶嵌皮甲.

Dero Ambush.name: 癫儒的伏击 Dero Ambush
Dero Ambush.text:
F2. 癫儒的伏击Low 7

这个洞穴曾经有数根石笋，但现在只剩下几十根破碎的石桩—有人把它们都砸碎了，只把大块的石头堆在东边的一个小丘上。洞穴的四个方向都有通道出口，但南面通道深处有东西闪烁着令人不快的橙色光芒.

北面的通道通往区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06midnightguar00]{G6}，而西面的隧道则在地下蜿蜒了一段距离，最后连接到 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11adoomedtown000#sandpointsettlement-4]{Sandpoint}地下的走私者隧道。 如果PC们沿着这条地道走，走2英里多一点就能到达@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11thepillbugsp00]{Pillbug's Pantry}的地下室；请参阅本章末尾的 “@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05thethirddoom00]{The Third Doom} ”（第 96 页）。在整个旅程中，隧道的宽度很少超过5尺，可能会让人感到有些幽闭恐惧症—在这条隧道中，PC们甚至可能会遇到一些癫儒或食尸鬼，但请记住，在这样一个狭窄的空间中进行战斗可能会让人感到沮丧而不是有趣！南面的隧道一直蜿蜒到区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20} ，我们将在该处对其进行描述.

Creatures:作为与午夜黎明协议的一部分，癫儒在这个房间里始终保持六名守卫。六个癫儒压制者（Dero Strangler）轮班工作，两个在废墟中巧妙隐藏的角落里休息，而其他四个则潜伏在洞穴的墙边，每个都盯着不同的出口。齐拉迪尼通过承诺癫儒们在这里守卫几轮后有机会沐浴在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]的光辉中来保持他们的专注——这个承诺让癫儒们感激不已，因为他们本质上对这种奇异的光辉上瘾.

Dero Ambush Low 7

@UUID[Actor.R6caSSMtmhrndXrR]{Dero Stranglers (6)}

四个警觉的癫儒以隐秘进行先攻检定，并分别对PC 施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR] 来发出警报。这声音不仅惊醒了两名熟睡的癫儒（它们会用察觉投掷先攻），也惊动了区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05templeofazat00]{F17} 的生物。癫儒们会战斗至死，并尽力阻止任何人向南进入区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20}，尽管他们不会追击进入该区域的敌人，因为他们害怕那个洞穴里潜伏的东西。如果PC们向西前往沙尖镇，癫儒压制者会追击他们大半天，希望阻止他们一路回到镇上.

Visander’s Lament.name: 维桑德的哀歌 Visander’s Lament
Visander’s Lament.text:
F3. 维桑德的哀歌Low 7

这个大洞穴的大部分地方都是荒芜的，但在洞穴的东南方，地面略微向下倾斜，形成一个浅水池，里面耸立着一片石笋林。这里的天花板上也悬挂着类似的钟乳石，其中一些与下面的石笋相连，形成闪闪发光的潮湿石柱.

为任何经过这些密集钟乳石和石笋的PC进行@Check[perception|dc:20]秘密检定，如果检定成功，他们就会发现一具古老的骷髅正坐在远处的石壁边。对中等体型PC，这一区域被视为高等困难地形，而对小体型PC则将其视为困难地形—在古老骷髅周围10尺内移动的人会自动注意到它.

Creatures: 这具骸骨属于里拉菈露的一名学徒，他是一个名叫维桑德（Visander）的失意者，曾多次试图获得里拉菈露的爱慕，但都以失败告终。被拒绝太多次后，他威胁要向符文领主卡祖格透露他怀疑里拉菈露正在进行的秘密研究。她假装害怕，用一个承诺将他引诱到这个洞穴，却用匕首刺进了他的喉咙—但即使死了，维桑德的痴迷也没有结束.

第二天午夜，维桑德作为一个幽魂（Specter）死而复生，这让里拉菈露非常高兴。她定期为他提供囚犯作为食物，让他保持安宁，因为他的存在是一个出色的守护者。在星陨之灾后不久，里拉菈露不再探望他。维桑德在接下来的数千年里饱受饥饿之苦——这是一段漫长的时间，期间偶尔会有“清醒”的时刻，每当有不幸的受害者靠近到足以让他吸食的距离时，这样的时刻便会到来.

现在，正是这样一个清醒的时刻，因为维桑德设法留住了一小部分卡利尼杀手（Caligni Slayer），他们曾经是上一层大部队的一部分，现在成了他的随从。这些杀手原本有四名，但因为他的进食，只剩下一半.

Visander's Lament Low 7

@UUID[Actor.0w2qSv6clpON4o4L]{Visander} @UUID[Actor.lxakK7geKCs4Ofrb]{Caligni Slayers (2)}

如果PC们在进入洞穴时没有保持隐蔽，两个杀手就会迅速移动到入口两侧隐藏起来，他们会从那里瞥见玩家的身影或听到玩家的靠近，并用隐秘来投掷先攻。他们急切地想活捉PC们，这样维桑德就有其他人可以吸食了，但其中一个杀手一被杀死，幽灵就愤怒地嘶吼着从石笋中飘浮出来。他一边这样做，一边用瑟西隆语喊道："你们看到我的爱人了吗？你看到里拉菈露了吗？你对里拉菈露做了什么！” 除非有PC公开佩戴了区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ritualprepar00]{F18}的得到的里拉菈露的雄辩项圈 ，否则他很快就会发动攻击。如果他发现了项圈，维桑德就会指控该PC是小偷，并要求他归还项圈。他会集中攻击该PC .

维桑德一直战斗到被摧毁。他无法离开这个洞穴，除非他发现了里拉菈露的雄辩项圈，在这种情况下，他会毫不留情地追击佩戴者—即使是在阳光下.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.O38jeOfXbWX1UWa4]{Skeletal Remains}
随着时间的流逝，维桑德的骸骨已经石化。虽然他的装备早已不复存在，但里拉菈露用来杀死他的那把精巧的淬毒匕首 仍插在他的喉咙里。要将匕首从石化的骨骸中拔出，需要成功通过@Check[athletics|dc:22] 检定—如果大失败，匕首就会折断。匕首的刀柄上有一个独特的八芒星图案—与里拉菈露的雄辩项圈和在大深坑底层可以找到的她的一些其他物品上的图案相同.

Stairwell.name: 阶梯井 Stairwell
Stairwell.text:
F4. 阶梯井

这段阶梯通往上方的区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20004footpr.JournalEntryPage.04creeperclan000]{E13b} （见第4章）.

Lightlock.name: 光芒锁 Lightlock
Lightlock.text:
F8. 光芒锁Trivial 7

这间密室的墙壁是用高度抛光的石料砌成的，只是在少数几个地方，有一些被撞碎的凹坑破坏了其光滑、几乎是湿润的表面.

这间密室曾经有一个强大的魔法陷阱，会让进入密室的人迷失方向，并被迫离开密室退回大深坑，失去对密室的记忆。但这个陷阱的魔法不再像以前那样有效。 相反，齐拉迪尼扭曲了这里残留的魔法，以至于任何带入房间的光源都会变得异常昏暗——尽管墙壁十分光滑，却几乎不反射光线，看起来仿佛被一层薄雾所笼罩.

进入区域F8a的暗门可以通过一个正在搜寻的PC通过@Check[perception|dc:20|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:search|name:Search] 检定发现.

Lightlock Trivial 7

@UUID[Actor.GSIERF7zy1YxcmRm]{Lightlock}

Hazard: 齐拉迪尼在这里布置的魔法结界会试图压制并摧毁带入房间的光线.

Scene NotesSFX

@UUID[Playlist.vzeckNwf4xKCbBPz.PlaylistSound.lRSrUMCZ8b1c81Aj]{Lightlock}

Processional.name: 前厅 Processional
Processional.text:
F9. 前厅Low 7

这间石室的石墙上，到处布满了被砸出的凹坑，破坏了石壁的平整。一股难闻的体味和排泄物的恶臭在屋内弥漫，无疑源自北墙旁那成堆的碎石和垃圾.

Processional Low 7

@UUID[Actor.ZlHLXZ97hNlh6Cmb]{Cavern Trolls (2)}

Creatures: 对站岗的两只洞穴巨魔（Cavern Troll）来说，靠墙堆放的污物堆就是舒适的巢穴。这两只巨魔热心地为齐拉迪尼服务，因为这只癫儒答应治愈它们阳光石化（Sunlight Petrification）的弱点。他在这一承诺上是诚实的，但更多地将此视为个人挑战，而非出于无私的善举。每年他都会数次将最新调配的药剂在一只巨魔身上试验，但迄今为止，他尚未发现任何能让它们免受阳光伤害超过几分钟的东西。然而，这对巨魔来说已足够作为证明，因此它们在这里热切地担任着守卫的角色。它们会见到PC们就发起攻击并与之战斗至死，并追逐逃跑的PC们穿过南边和西边的双开门—但它们对于干扰那些房间内的住客却十分谨慎，以免惹恼它们的主人，让她违背承诺。（译者注：齐拉迪尼为男性，此处应为他）.

Scriptorium of Stars.name: 星辰书房 Scriptorium of Stars
Scriptorium of Stars.text:
F10. 星辰书房Moderate 7

北方有三扇铁制的牢房门敞开着。每个牢房内都摆着一张石桌。主屋的西侧还有另一张桌子，桌上堆满了卷轴、石板和工具，显得杂乱无章。东面的墙壁上闪烁着数百个光点，仿佛有人试图用发光的金色涂料将夜空中所有的星星都描绘出来.

通往区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05oubliette00000]{F11}的暗门尚未被格里欧斯邪教徒们发现，但搜寻牢房的PC可以通过@Check[perception|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:search|name:Search] 检定发现这扇门.

如果一名PC仔细观察了墙上的发光图案，并成功通过了@Check[nature|dc:23|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge]检定或@Check[occultism|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge]检定来回忆知识（Recall Knowledge），那么他就可以确认这是一张以格拉利昂的太阳为中心的星图大成功可以让PC意识到这幅星图的目的似乎是在追踪宇宙中的奇异力量，这些力量在穿越黑暗异幕（Dark Tapestry）时的活动会扰乱星辰、毁灭世界——但这些与将格拉利昂星系置于中心位置有何关联尚不清楚.

Creatures: 在齐拉迪尼雄心勃勃地寻求对抗阳光对肉体的影响的过程中，他招募了一些盟友，其中包括三只蝙蝠状的外星生物，它们被称为格里欧斯（Grioth）。齐拉迪尼摧毁了一把特制的注入了@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]能量的宝石匕首，将它们从星空中召唤了下来，然后与它们达成了协议。在用一年的时间记录下格里欧斯们所知道的关于黑暗异幕（Dark Tapestry）中能够吞噬太阳的毁灭性力量的一切之后，他答应向他们揭示他为了吸引他们的注意力而摧毁的宝石匕首中诱人能量的来源.

这三个格里欧斯是外神的狂热崇拜者，齐拉迪尼用来引诱他们的能量，他们深信是来自他们无意识的神圣守护神的散落意念。其中两个格里欧斯是典型的邪教徒，他们崇敬夜魔（The Haunter Of The Dark），但他们的首领是一位更强大的阿撒托斯牧师，名叫伊兹米罗（Iazmilor），他花了几个世纪的时间寻找宇宙的中心，以便能亲眼目睹阿撒托斯的荣耀。三人已经服务了快10个月了，他们并不急于冒险去探寻更多有关空洞之星的信息，因此一直在勤奋地用邪灵语在日记中撰写有关黑暗异幕的大量内容，以便日后供齐拉迪尼参考.

Scriptorium of Stars Moderate 7

@UUID[Actor.V5SJbqpQDZjWPdKo]{Iazmilor} @UUID[Actor.3GHzj1U3GssgwcOm]{Grioth Cultists (2)}

两个邪教徒在北边西侧和中间的牢房里工作，而伊兹米罗则在主房间里工作，他不时暂停在书桌前撰写日记的工作，查阅、添加或更正东墙上他过去 10 个月来一直在绘制的星图。外星人们对打断他们的工作感到不耐烦和恼火，但他们对格拉利昂的生命形式还不够了解，不知道PC们可能不是癫儒的盟友。如果玩家携带光源，牧师会好奇地询问他们为什么需要光源。除此之外，他们还询问他们是否带来了齐拉迪尼的其他要求，然后就不耐烦地要求让他们继续完成任务。当然，格里欧斯人只会说邪灵语，但如果PC们能与他们交流，也许能了解到一些有关齐拉迪尼在这一地区的目标。对话每持续一分钟，说话的 PC 就必须成功 “说谎”。如果做不到这一点，就意味着他们所说的某些话会让伊兹米罗突然意识到他们是委托人的敌人，于是他命令他的邪教徒们立即发动攻击，希望通过向齐拉迪尼献上俘虏来确保早日接近空洞之星.

如果PC们身上有明显的与癫儒为敌的痕迹，或者他们未能迅速与格里欧斯们开始交流，那么这种攻击很可能会更快发生。一旦战斗开始，格里欧斯们战斗至死.

Oubliette.name: 遗忘地牢 Oubliette
Oubliette.text:
F11. 遗忘地牢

一具人类骸骨斜躺在这间密室的东南角。骷髅骨瘦如柴的一只手紧紧抓住一块锋利的金属残片—也许他正是用这块金属残片用来雕刻密室墙壁上密密麻麻的文字.

在里拉菈露统治建筑群期间，这个房间曾被用作一个隐蔽的禁闭室，用来囚禁特别令人讨厌或烦人的囚犯。这间密室最后的居住者是一名双面间谍—他曾潜入里拉菈露的核心圈子，并差点向卡祖格报告她的活动，后因里拉菈露精通预言系魔法而被发现。他在这里度过了生命的最后时光，但为了记录他所了解到的有关里拉菈露的情况，他用一块偷运进监狱的金属碎片在墙壁上划出了数百行文字.

这些文字是用瑟西隆语写成的；能读懂这些文字的 PC 可以用它们对神秘的第八符文领主进行研究（Research）检定，每次检定需要研究这些文字2小时。详情请参见@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20012advent.JournalEntryPage.12researchingt00].

Reward: 如果PC们完全研究了这个被遗忘的地牢墙壁上刻的文字，给予他们40XP.

Clone Vault.text:
F12. 克隆体仓库Moderate 7

房间中央摆放着一张长长的石桌，桌上摆放着各种奇怪的手术工具和炼金用品。靠着最东边的墙壁，矗立着五具奇怪的石棺；其中四具石棺的表面都是磨光的石头，每具石棺的表面都有一个七芒星符文。中央的石棺已经破碎，碎石下的地板上有一块奇怪的绿色污渍.

在里拉菈露努力学习 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pZr1xrCpaSu6qrXU]仪式的过程中，她尝试了几种可能的捷径，试图降低魔法的复杂程度。她想出了一种方法，利用塑肉体技术（Fleshwarping）培育出躯体，并将它们储存在这里，但始终无法真正完成将灵魂安置在这些躯体中的过程.

癫儒们在想出打开其他石棺的方法之前就砸碎了中央石棺，并利用他们获得的“原材料”试图克隆出能够忍耐阳光的自己。研究其余四个石棺中的一个并成功进行@Check[arcana|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[nature|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[religion|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic] or @Check[occultism|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic]辨识魔法检定的 PC 不仅会发现如何按照正确的顺序触摸石棺表面的七芒秘印点位来打开其余四个石棺（作为一个交互动作），还会意识到任何放置在石棺中的尸体都会停止腐烂过程，这与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]的效果类似。打开任何一个石棺，里面畸形的癫儒实验体都会翻滚出来，绿色的防腐凝胶洒满一地。这些令人讨厌的躯体扭曲而可怕，任何看到这些无生命遗骸的PC都必须成功进行一次@Check[will|dc:20]豁免，以避免陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18] (大失败则 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 2}，之后他们就会对这种景象的冲击免疫.

Clone Vault Moderate 7

@UUID[Actor.pQhyorHM61ZvwxBe]{Dero Magisters (4)}

Creatures: 四名癫儒学士（Dero Magisters）在这个房间里工作，他们有的在维护桌上的工具，有的再用邪灵语讨论克隆理论的方法。PC们的到来让这些活动戛然而止—他们立刻发动攻击，战斗至死.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.bbPsxJzreY1MTaZp]{Central Table}
中央桌子上的工具包括一个专家炼金实验室和一套专家医疗工具包.
Clone Vault.name: 克隆体仓库 Clone Vault

Secret Library.name: Secret Library
Secret Library.text:
F13. Secret LibraryLow 7

The secret door that provides access to this room can be discovered by a Searching PC who succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:search|name:Search] check. The deros haven’t discovered this room yet.

The walls of this room are lined with stone bookshelves, although only a small fraction of what once must have been an impressive library remains in place today.

Secret Library Low 7

@UUID[Actor.Im2S1oQsSerL0H20]{Wood Golems (2)}

Creatures: A pair of wood golems carved from redwood and sculpted into the shape of women with sharp features and long, braided hair stand guard in this chamber. Fashioned in the likeness of Liralarue herself, the golems have stood vigil in this room, patiently, for eons. They slowly creak to animated life the instant anyone who doesn’t look like Liralarue enters the room, but due to their long period of inactivity, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for the first round of combat and suffer a –4 penalty to initiative checks (this penalty is included in the stats that follow). The wood golems fight until destroyed, but do not pursue foes from this room, as their ancient orders preclude them from abandoning this chamber.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.qnIj3yG8JpG3f5Yj]{Secret Library} @UUID[Actor.kVQ53MK7hiNy06aG]{Unusual Tome}
Most of the books kept here have decayed over the ages, so that only the most well-made remain. These books—all of which are written in Thassilonian— consist of a collection that is 10 Bulk in total, but when used together they grant a +2 item bonus on any Arcana or Occultism check made to Research necromancy-themed questions or to Recall Knowledge while Investigating. The collection is worth 600 gp in all.

A character who succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:22|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:search|name:Search] check while Searching this room for at least 10 minutes discovers an unusual tome—an undertaker’s manifest.

Office.name: Office
Office.text:
F14. OfficeLow 7

A low rectangular table sits in the middle of this room, with two high-backed wooden chairs with leather cushions and purple velvet lining sitting to either side. Several books sit open on the table.

Office Low 7

@UUID[Actor.XX5fAYkqViRvS9Gt]{Dero Cultists (2)}

Creatures: Once a place for Liralarue to meet with visitors from the transport room, the deros have turned the office into a quiet room to study and discuss research. Currently, two dero cultists are taking advantage of the room to discuss whether Ziradini’s plans to defeat the sun’s burning light are even viable, or if the time may soon come for a change of leadership. The cultists leap to their feet, looking guilty for a moment before they realize the PCs aren’t their leader. They attack at once and fight to the death, unsure if the PCs overheard their plotting.

Clone Lab.name: Clone Lab
Clone Lab.text:
F16. Clone LabModerate 7

Stone shelves hold collections of books and magical equipment along this large room’s east and west walls, while in the center of the room sit three circular stone tables. Partially dissected, barely humanoid bodies lie sprawled on the tables amid even more magical tools and medical devices. A confusing medley of scents—spices, blood, incense, and less-identifiable odors—fill the air.

This room was used by Liralarue to research methods of crafting clones, and the deros who dwell here today are doing their best to follow in those footsteps, although without the ability to actually create clones, the best they’ve been able to manage are the distorted fleshwarps on the tables—twisted mixtures of deros and other humanoids (a goblin, a xulgath, and a human) that never quite had a chance to live.

Clone Lab Moderate 7

@UUID[Actor.pQhyorHM61ZvwxBe]{Dero Magisters (2)} @UUID[Actor.R6caSSMtmhrndXrR]{Dero Stranglers (4)}

Creatures: Two dero magisters and four dero stranglers toil in this room, examining the failed fleshwarpings on the tables, studying tomes, or comparing notes in hushed tones. They shriek in rage if interrupted and attack on sight. They pursue the PCs through the entire dungeon and rouse others as they go, fighting to the death.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.k1r2LfJiLvYQ1Io1]{Clone Lab}
The books and equipment on the shelves here are what one would expect from an ancient medical laboratory. The collection is the product of several generations of dero research into the question “Why does the sun burn us?” Several of the newer books incorporate discoveries the deros have made here in the Cloneworks—an hour of Investigation by someone who can read Aklo is enough to piece together the deros’ plan to craft new, cloned bodies they can then use to dwell upon the surface world and rule it without fear of the sun, but they’re quite far from reaching anything close to success. The books also serve well as medical and anatomy references, and grant a +1 item bonus if used while Investigating to Recall Knowledge with Medicine checks or with Occultism checks concerning aberrations. The collection is 8 Bulk, and is worth 100 gp in all.

Transport Room.name: Transport Room
Transport Room.text:
F15. Transport Room

A circular black stone platform adorned with the engraving of a seven-pointed star sits in a large alcove on the western side of this otherwise empty room.

The circular stone platform was once one of the many teleportation circles created by Liralarue. This one led to a hidden laboratory she’d constructed far behind enemy lines to the south, near the outskirts of Runelord Sorshen’s city of Xin-Eurythnia. This platform can be identified and utilized in the same way as those that appear in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20003whistl.JournalEntryPage.03spysworkshop00]{D15}.

Temple of Azathoth.name: Temple of Azathoth
Temple of Azathoth.text:
F17. Temple of AzathothModerate 7

Nearly a dozen small bedrolls lie on the floor to the north and south of this chamber. The air here feels cold and weirdly thin, almost as if it were located atop a high mountain, and the mournful sound of wind racing over uneven badlands seems to echo across a vast distance. The ceiling above appears to look out into a star-filled sky, while at the center of the room looms an unsettling “statue” of a roughly spherical mass covered with nodules, lumps, shallow gashes, and other strange imperfections, all painted in an almost hypnotic pattern of twisting strokes of green, brown, yellow, and red paint.

Many years of focused worship to the Outer God Azathoth have infused this chamber with layers of unsettling phantasms—the sound of wind, the thin air, and the starry “sky” above are all what amounts to an effect akin to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]; a successful @Check[will|dc:23|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] save made by anyone who Seeks in an attempt to see through the images or sensations reveals the plain nature of the room.

The strange statue in the middle of the room is very real, though, and a successful @Check[occultism|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] or @Check[religion|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge is enough to identify it as a representation of the vastness of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.sILda7I8Ak20Ioj9]{Azathoth} itself, said to be an immense seething chaos the size of a star that churns at the center of the universe.

Creatures: The deros both sleep and worship in this room whenever they’re not guarding or researching in other areas. Much of their worship consists of using sanding cloths and rough stones to polish and grind away at the statue in a constant quest to perfect Azathoth’s image, in the belief that if the deros can capture the god’s shape perfectly, it will become the god and consume the sun above. Whether or not this belief has any basis in fact is left to the GM to decide, but the two dero cultists and two dero stranglers found here take swift exception to any intrusions and attack at once.

Temple of Azathoth Moderate 7

@UUID[Actor.XX5fAYkqViRvS9Gt]{Dero Cultists (2)} @UUID[Actor.R6caSSMtmhrndXrR]{Dero Stranglers (2)}

The unnerving presence of Azathoth’s statue in this room doesn’t function as a proper hazard, but it does have an additional impact on anyone who fails a Will save against a mental effect. Creatures that do so in this chamber receive a brief vision of the vastness at the center of the Material Plane and a glimpse of the outer god drifting therein and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute in addition to any other effects from the triggering failed Will save. On a critical failure, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} condition persists until it is cured through magic. The deros are quite aware of this effect, and do their best to target spellcasters in particular with spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mkbq9xlAUxHUHyR2]{Paranoia}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CQb8HtQ1BPeZmu9h], hoping to grant their foes the “gift” of a glimpse of Azathoth.

Ziradini’s Room.name: Ziradini’s Room
Ziradini’s Room.text:
F19. Ziradini’s RoomModerate 7

In the northwest corner of this room stands a five-by-ten-foot iron cage, its floor littered with strips of meat and sheets of mold. Nearby is a grisly worktable made of bones atop which are stacked several alchemical tools and supplies, while to the south, a simple bedroll and a stack of books lie on the floor to the side of a misshapen altar stone. The top of the stone is splattered with blood and lumps of meat, skin, and hair. Yet for all of this, the southern wall is the most unsettling sight of all, for here looms what can only be described as a mural of a vast churning sphere drifting in the inky depths of outer space, fashioned from what appear to be still-living swatches of flesh and skin stretched over nodules in the stone wall itself.

The secret door in the southwest wall can be spotted by a PC who Seeks and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] check. The cage in the northwest area is for the safekeeping of sacrifices to the altar of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.sILda7I8Ak20Ioj9]{Azathoth} (see Hazard); it’s currently empty unless a PC or NPC in your game has been captured by the dero.

Creature: The leader of the Azathoth-worshipping, clone-studying deros dwells here—a stocky, well-mustached, wild-haired brute whose athletic build belies his intense knowledge of anatomy. This is Ziradini, a zealot and a sadist whose only potentially redeeming quality—an obsessive quest to develop a “cure” for his people’s deadly allergy to the sun—is put into doubt by the grisly and cruel methods he uses in pursuit of this goal. His devotion to the chaos that is Azathoth only enhances his unpredictable whims of brutality.

Upon spotting the PCs, he cackles in delight and asks which one of them has come before him to volunteer their flesh for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]{Hollow Star}. If the PCs play along, Ziradini asks the PC who volunteers to gaze upon the southern mural and concentrate upon its glory, thereby exposing them to this unfortunate hazard. The party can stall for time before taking this step by keeping a conversation going with Ziradini. As long as one PC can achieve a @Check[arcana|dc:30], @Check[medicine|dc:30], @Check[occultism|dc:30] or @Check[religion|dc:30] check each round, Ziradini is eager to continue talking before growing impatient. Each round, depending on the question the PCs ask, feel free to have him reveal a bit of information about this level, the temple on the level below (areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06templethresh00]{G1}–@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06hiddensanctu00]{G5}), the history of the Keepers of the Hollow Star, or their alliance with the Midnight Dawn and his fears that the midnight milk might be something more than a dream-inducing drug.

Ziradini's Room Moderate 7

@UUID[Actor.RvUoZZHTvJlQrF5F]{Ziradini} @UUID[Actor.32qoXC8ctWTdhbuQ]{Flesh for the Hollow Star}

Once a round passes without such a success, the dero demands the PCs present themselves to the Hollow Star; if they still refuse, he attacks. Ziradini opens combat by using the Grim Curse of Azathoth on the most religious-looking PC, then uses area effect magic to blast away at the party, using his third action each round after casting a spell either to Strike at an adjacent PC with his warhammer or to cast a heal spell on himself. If reduced to fewer than 50 Hit Points, Ziradini flees through the secret door to the balcony overlooking area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20} to call out to Azathoth for aid before hurling himself into the water and swimming east toward the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]{Hollow Star} to invoke it in a hopeful attempt for salvation. See area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20} for more details.

Hazard: The unsettling mural on the wall is a half-living bas-relief depicting Azathoth and crafted of leathery flesh and bone, as much the result of Ziradini’s obsessive faith as his skill at crafting.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.STBQpHTM28CROf3t]{Satchel}
The small collection of books in this room are occult tomes that discuss numerous different ways in which worlds can end—in each book, scenarios involving eternal night or the destruction of the sun have been heavily annotated in Aklo by Ziradini. A PC who can read these notes and spends 8 hours pouring through the books and succeeds at a @Check[occultism|dc:23] or @Check[religion|dc:23] check to comprehend the rambling writing can piece together much of the history and unlikely goals of the Keepers of the Hollow Star. A critical success allows a character to interpret metaphors and strange turns of phrase to understand how the Hollow Star itself functions (see area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20}).

In addition to this information, anyone who studies the books for this length of time learns about the agreement between the deros and a group called the Midnight Dawn, regardless of the result of a check to comprehend the religious and occult nature of the notes. The notes make it clear that not only are the deros to allow passage from members of this group through the tunnels at area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}, and that the western passage leads to Sandpoint, but also specifically mention Aliver Podiker by name, indicating that Ziradini is to provide the alchemist what aid and supplies he requests within reason. In return, the Midnight Dawn has promised to aid the deros in their goals; mention is made of several books about clones and the properties of sunlight that have been delivered to the cult and are now stored in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05clonelab000000]{F16}.

The most important discovery the PCs can make here are Ziradini’s notes on midnight milk. These notes are written in Aklo on a rolled up parchment tucked into an empty vial in a leather satchel sitting next to Ziradini’s bedroll. The satchel also contains two doses of experimental midnight milk, three philter of empty dreams, and a few folded scraps of paper that contain Ziradini’s formula for the philter of empty dreams (also written in Aklo). The dero’s notes on midnight milk are reproduced as @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20013handou]{Handout #1}. If the PCs don’t recognize Podiker’s name, allow each PC a @Check[society|dc:17] or @Check[sandpoint-lore|dc:13] check to know who the note is referring to.

Ritual Preparation Study.name: Ritual Preparation Study
Ritual Preparation Study.text:
F18. Ritual Preparation Study

The secret door to this chamber can be spotted by a PC who Seeks and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] check. The deros haven’t discovered the chamber beyond. As soon as anyone opens the secret door, the two candelabras in the room flare with flickering light.

The air in this octagonal chamber is stale and musty. A writing desk and a high-backed cushioned chair sit in the center of the room, while shelves to the north and south hold several books, a few skulls of strange creatures, and a few other objects. A canopied bed sits against the western wall, its deep purple sheets covered with a layer of dust. Two iron candelabras flicker with light near the eastern entrance.

This room is one of several that Liralarue kept to serve as a private place to study and rest. As with the other similar rooms found on the lower levels, this study had a specific purpose—to prepare her mind for the studying and performing of rituals.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.uNKhwAmHy3MrsuaP]{Shelves}
A character who studies the bed and makes a successful @Check[arcana|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[nature|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[religion|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic] or @Check[occultism|dc:25|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic] check to Identify Magic understands the use of this chamber. Spending 8 hours sleeping in the bed grants a character a +2 item bonus to all skill checks made to learn or cast rituals for the next 16 hours. In addition, if a character performs their daily preparations immediately after waking from 8 hours of sleep in this bed, they gain the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ZYoC630tNGutgbE0]{Hypercognition} once during the next 16 hours as an innate arcane spell. A character can gain these effects from the bed once per week.

Among the objects on the shelves are a few dozen books about divination magic and theory, as well as a codex of unimpeded sight. The skulls are of people who vexed or annoyed Liralarue, and each has been painted with runes in Thassilonian meant to ensure that the souls that once were a part of these skulls would be judged harshly in the afterlife (fortunately for those who perished, these runes had no such actual power). One of the skulls has a removable top, and inside sits a choker of elocution that bears an eight-pointed star design. This choker grants the language of Necril, and wearing it visibly solicits a reaction from the specter Visander in area F3. The shelves also display a silver flute (a lesser maestro’s instrument), a decanter of endless water carved to resemble a drunk marid riding a dolphin, a darkwood buckler adorned with the Shoanti word for greed, and a basilisk eye talisman inside of a bottle containing a dose of truth potion that must be smashed in order to get the talisman out. Finally, a bejeweled scroll tube worth 80 gp contains a scroll of banishment.

Finally, Liralarue’s extensive notes and glosses penned in Thassilonian in the margins of the books kept here can be used to research the Eighth Runelord (@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20012advent.JournalEntryPage.12researchingt00]{Researching the Eighth}), but the scattershot nature of the notes means that each Research check takes 4 hours of work. Among the other revelations, one of these notes should reveal the tragic fate of the specter Visander—see area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05visanderslam00]{F3}.

Reward: Grant the PCs 40 XP if they discover Liralarue’s notes here.

Lake of the Hollow Star.name: Lake of the Hollow Star
Lake of the Hollow Star.text:
F20. Lake of the Hollow StarSevere 7

Softly glowing patches of pale-blue fungus and mold grow in strips along the walls and ceiling of this large cavern, giving the entire place the illusion of being underwater. To the north, a five-foot-wide ledge descends, switching back on itself before reaching a lower area overlooking a large lake of dark, rippling water. Across the water, a stone balcony looks out over the lake. On the opposite side of the lake, a sphere of glowing orange crystal the size of a human head sits atop a low mound of gravel and mold.

The pool of water in this room is stagnant, cold, and thick with dark flecks of algae that give it a murky, almost black coloration. Now and then, ripples disturb the water surface—evidence of passage by the creatures within the lake. The water surface is 10 feet below the edge of the ledges to the north and southeast, while the balcony connecting to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ziradinisroo00]{F19} is 25 feet above the water. The water averages 20 feet in depth, but is calm; only a successful @Check[athletics|dc:10|traits:move,skill,action:swim|name:Swim] check is needed to Swim in it. The rock walls between the ledge and water are slick and can be Climbed with a @Check[athletics|dc:20|traits:move,skill,action:climb|name:Climb] check.

Creatures: Though the water is calm, it is far from safe, for the transformed remnants of six sacrifices who were offered to Azathoth in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ziradinisroo00]{F19} now dwell here. These half-dozen pale masses of twisted, bubbling flesh are gibbering mouthers, and while they fear the deros and remain hidden in their presence, they react poorly to others who approach. While they spend most of their time underwater, they can’t breathe water and must surface now and then to gasp for air—every [[/r 1d4 #rounds]] rounds, one or two of the monsters skim the surface to do just this. When they do, the weird combination of gasping and strange ululations as they exhale makes it obvious that something’s dwelling in the lake. A PC who succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:15] check sees and hears enough that they can attempt a @Check[occultism|dc:20] check to identify the things.

Lake of the Hollow Star Severe 7

@UUID[Actor.6u8Xe6WJUqvwTXeP]{Gibbering Mouthers (6)}

As soon as a non-dero approaches within 5 feet of the water’s edge, the gibbering mouthers react swiftly, surfacing with a splash to howl, hoot, and trill, rolling Perception for initiative. They attack at range with their spittle, but if a PC remains at a ledge’s edge, one of the gibbering mouthers swims over and attempts a @Check[athletics|dc:20|traits:move,skill,action:climb|name:Climb] check to climb up the ledge. Once the mouther is clinging to the ledge under a PC, it attempts to use Ground Manipulation on the ledge to weaken the stone, causing it to sluice away in a localized mudslide into the water. This causes the gibbering mouther to fall back into the water, while the PC who was standing on the ledge above must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save to avoid falling into the water as well.

They prefer not to emerge from the water, but if the PCs attack from a distance or cover, they’ll certainly climb up the ledge to get them, with one exception—no gibbering mouther will climb up to the southeastern ledge where the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPwrN4KBPycME0tl]{Hollow Star} sits, nor will a gibbering mouther attack a character who holds that item, even if they attack the monsters. The gibbering mouthers fight to the death.

If @UUID[Actor.RvUoZZHTvJlQrF5F]{Ziradini} flees into the water here from area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ziradinisroo00]{F19}, he swims and climbs up to the southwestern ledge to retrieve the Hollow Star from its cradle, and prepares to use it against the PCs if they pursue. If the PCs do not, he returns to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ziradinisroo00]{F19} (leaving the Hollow Star behind) after waiting for an hour.

Ziradini assumes the gibbering mouthers fear and respect him enough to leave him alone, but if he enters the water with fewer than 30 Hit Points, the monsters sense his weakness and immediately converge on him to take advantage of the opportunity, chewing him apart in a swift and bloody revenge.

Scene NotesAudio

@UUID[Macro.aZxRAhA0QTh7EJZv]{Toggle Gibbering Mouthers}

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.gE1PoKBWedqKkUaR]{Eastern Shelf}
The greatest treasure of the Keepers of the Hollow Star lies on the eastern shelf, kept here in a cradle of gravel and mold until it is needed. This is the Hollow Star itself, a powerful, unique magic item associated with the Outer God @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.sILda7I8Ak20Ioj9]{Azathoth}. While the Hollow Star is a potent treasure, handling it is risky, and the PCs may decide to destroy it instead of keeping it. If your PCs do so out of fear that the item could do more harm than good if left intact, congratulate them on their wise decision.

Scene NotesMacro

@UUID[Macro.0XEjk1uinVIhhX5e]{Take/Destroy The Hollow Star}

Reward: If the PCs decide to destroy the Hollow Star, grant them 60 XP.

Strange Dreams.name: Strange Dreams
Strange Dreams.text:
Strange Dreams

At some point, soon after the PCs reach 7th level, Aliver begins to put into motion the initial steps of the Midnight Dawn’s plan—he doses a few rain-barrels and water supplies in town with vials of his experimental dilution of midnight milk, hoping to slowly infect numerous citizens with the drug so that their dreams can be targeted by the Midnight Dawn. Aliver isn’t precisely sure why or how the Midnight Dawn will be “targeting dreams,” but he believes that as long as he avoids exposing himself to the drug, he has nothing to worry about. And since so many in @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11adoomedtown000#sandpointsettlement-4]{Sandpoint} have vexed and annoyed him, he feels no remorse for his actions.

Music NotesMusic

@UUID[Playlist.YHCeMbIzyQ6wPX5j.PlaylistSound.WO90b0iMZze74JAA]{Strange Dreams (loop)}, @UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.uQDOJThNW3xpqky0]{Strange Dreams}

The initial effects of this subtle poisoning of the water supply cause a few locals to start having unusual dreams of being lost in caverns, of floating through vast underground vistas, or even of having strangely nostalgic glimpses of beautiful cities they’ve never seen before. It’s possible some of the PCs might even experience some of these dreams. @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20002strang.JournalEntryPage.02dreamsofmidn00]{Dreams of Midnight} encounter is another way to reinforce the notion that Sandpoint’s dreams may be in danger.

If a PC wishes to look into this development, they can spend 4 hours Investigating the situation in Sandpoint, speaking to those who had strange dreams, comparing notes on their activities, studying and searching for commonalities, and researching the matter on their own. To determine their success, a PC must attempt a @Check[diplolmacy|dc:23] or @Check[society|dc:23] check (if they’re interviewing locals or walking the streets for clues) or a @Check[occultism|dc:23] check (if they’re researching dreams and other occult topics for clues). On a success, the PC confirms that the dreams are similar enough that they’re likely connected, but also notes that all of those who had the dreams lived relatively near each other in one of three fairly tight clusters—one centered on Salmon Street/Razor Street, one on Prickleback Lane/Chopper’s Alley, and one on River Street/Mud Lane. On a critical success, the PC strongly suspects that those who had the dreams were exposed to some sort of drug or toxin, or possibly even a magical effect.

If the PCs decide to patrol the streets at night, roll a @Check[flat|dc:19] to determine whether Aliver sneaks out that night to dose another rain barrel. If he does, each PC who spends the night patrolling parts of town southeast of Festival Street has a chance to spot Aliver getting up to no good. To do so, the patrolling PC must first succeed at a @Check[stealth|dc:26] check (since Aliver doesn’t take action if he thinks he’s being observed). Each PC who succeeds at this check can then attempt a @Check[perception|dc:24] Perception check. On a successful Perception check, the PC spots Aliver skulking down an alleyway late at night, but he’s already dosed a barrel and doesn’t carry any experimental midnight milk, and feigns innocence, claiming he was out for a walk and some refreshing night air. On a critical success, a PC spots Aliver dosing a rain barrel.

If confronted, Aliver attempts to flee back to his shop, then makes his way down to the basement to gather any incriminating evidence and his stash of funds. This takes him 30 minutes to accomplish. He fights back if cornered on the street only if he has no other choice, and even then, he does his best to engineer a chance to flee or hide.

The Third Doom.name: The Third Doom
The Third Doom.text:
The Third Doom

The Third Doom that @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11adoomedtown000#sandpointsettlement-4]{Sandpoint} faces doesn’t directly stem from foes within the Pit, but it certainly has been enabled by those who dwell deeper in the dungeon. Local alchemist Aliver “Pillbug” Podiker is one of Sandpoint’s less reputable citizens, a man whose ties to the town’s criminal side and whose own lack of morals have bothered several of the town’s more righteous or kindly citizens. As a secret supplier of poisons to local thieves, his criminal activities escalated from small-time crook to truly dangerous villain when he became involved with the Midnight Dawn.

Aliver knows that Kaleb Valdemar is involved with the group, but his primary point of contact is with the ghast alchemist Kanker, who dwells deep in the Pit. His association with Kanker predated the Midnight Dawn’s arrival in the region, and it was at Kanker’s suggestion that the Midnight Dawn turned to Aliver as a convenient in-town agent for their plans. Not only could Aliver help the Midnight Dawn move toward their goal of infecting the citizens of Sandpoint with midnight milk (and thus making the entire population of the town susceptible to remote invasion from far below via an artifact known as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KBLQtEU6Ya9LT8WW]{Dream Lens}), if adventurers uncovered the plot early, it would look like the machinations of a lone mastermind.

Confronting Aliver.name: Confronting Aliver
Confronting Aliver.text:
Confronting AliverTrivial 7

If confronted in his shop, Aliver tries to throw the PCs off the trail by implying that he’s seen his Raven Street competitor, Nisk Tander of @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11bottledsolut00]{Bottled Solutions}, acting suspicious. If he manages to throw the PCs off his trail, he heads down to the basement to gather his supplies and flee. If the PCs see through his deception, he fights his way down to the basement to make his last stand. If reduced to fewer than 40 Hit Points, he flees through the secret doors to make his way to the Pit.

The Pillbug’s Pantry

The entrance to Aliver’s shop (area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11thepillbugsp00]{16} in Sandpoint) is located at the northwesternmost end of Tanglefoot Alley. Secret doors in the shop can be spotted with a successful @Check[perception|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] check by a Seeking PC.

A is the main shop; the shelves here have a wide range of low-level alchemical and medicinal supplies for sale.

B is the back hallway. The secret door in the wall opens into a neighboring alley.

C is a storeroom for supplies and reagents; the secret door leads to the basement stairs.

D is Aliver’s living quarters. He takes care to keep nothing incriminating here.

E is Aliver’s alchemical laboratory; it’s here that he’s been doing his work on experimental midnight milk.

F is a short tunnel that connects to the more extensive smuggler’s tunnels below Sandpoint.

G is a more recent excavation dug through the ground a few years ago by Kanker’s ghouls to take advantage of his alliance with Aliver. A PC who follows this tunnel’s winding route eventually reaches area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}.

Eventually, the PCs should learn that Aliver is up to no good. They might catch him in the act and chase or stalk him back to his shop. They could learn about his involvement by discovering Ziradini’s note in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05ziradinisroo00]{F19}. They also could learn about him through chance, sheer luck, or as the result of an entirely different set of circumstances that arise in your game. One possibility is simply arriving at his shop’s basement after traveling from area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2} in the Pit.

Music NotesMusic

@UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.7HwJRWxdwhYR5WgY]{Midnight Milk}, @UUID[Playlist.YHCeMbIzyQ6wPX5j.PlaylistSound.RpJEJTVIVpRcWHSt]{Seven Dooms For Sandpoint (Loop)}, @UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.TXRh1D5dUbWoTCLN]{Seven Dooms For Sandpoint}

Confronting Aliver Trivial 7

@UUID[Actor.Xrwz0r4y4wKiEZfr]{Aliver "Pillbug" Podiker}

If the PCs come from the tunnel in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}, they might stumble into his shop basement almost by accident. If they do, roll a @Check[flat|dc:8]—on a success, Aliver is upstairs when they arrive, and on a critical success he’s in the laboratory.

If Aliver escapes to the Pit, whether or not he manages to bring his incriminating evidence with him, he seeks out @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20012advent.JournalEntryPage.12kanker00000000]{Kanker} and begs for asylum. In this case, the PCs encounter him again at the end of @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20008wherec]{Chapter 8}.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.1IwOMArUOJ0dWoXZ]{Lab Equipment} @UUID[Actor.2a4n9yuvEJZhHHHp]{Supplies}
A wide range of alchemical supplies, tools, elixirs, poisons, and other resources are upstairs in Aliver’s shop. Once word gets out about Aliver’s machinations, Mayor Deverin and Sheriff Hemlock see to it that Nisk Tander of Bottled Solutions is put in charge of cataloging the shop’s supplies and setting up the stock to be sold to generate money for the town’s use, but at your discretion, the PCs could be given the chance to buy some of the stock at a discount—but only after Mayor Deverin allows the PCs to pick and choose from the supplies here as a reward, allowing them to each pick up to 50 gp in common alchemical items of level 4 or lower.

The lab equipment in Aliver’s basement includes a complete expanded alchemist’s lab. If Aliver had 30 minutes to gather his supplies here, these tools are the only items of interest, but if the PCs get to this room before he can do so, they’ll find much more. In addition to a small coffer containing 120 gp, the PCs can find six doses of experimental midnight milk, three greater darkvision elixirs, four lesser elixirs of life, and three doses of giant wasp venom.

Aliver’s Return?

If Aliver is slain, or even if he’s imprisoned, he (or his body) might go missing, if you so choose, ensuring a continuing sense of danger. In this case, Aliver’s remains have been snatched by Tiluatchek, and when the PCs encounter the intellect devourer in @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20008wherec]{Chapter 8}, Aliver’s body may be one of those that the monster has an option to wear.

But perhaps the most important items found here, if the PCs arrive before Aliver can flee with them, are the incriminating documents he keeps handy. These documents are proof of his long-term dealings with criminals and poison trafficking, but are written in a mix of Aklo and Necril. A PC who can read both languages can attempt to decipher the code Aliver used to keep his notes by spending an hour Deciphering Writing and succeeding at a @Check[society|dc:20|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:decipher-writing|name:Decipher Writing] check. Once decoded, a character can read the documents in just 2 hours to learn all about Aliver’s role in these activities, including details on the vanishing of many forlorn elves from the slums of Magnimar over the course of the past decade—elves who were missed by no one, weren’t particularly high on anyone’s list to investigate, and who were all delivered by Aliver to Kanker as meals in order to keep his alliance with the ghast going. The notes imply that Aliver “prepared” these elves for Kanker, but do not detail who or what Kanker is, or exactly how the “preparations” were performed.

Finally, several entries near the back of the documents indicate that Aliver has recently secured an agreement with a group called the Midnight Dawn to aid in their “dream experiments.” Little more information is forthcoming, other than to note that none other than “K. Valdemar” is Aliver’s primary point of contact with the group.

If the PCs capture Aliver alive, they (or agents of the Town Watch) might be able to learn more from him, but not too much more. Aliver knows that Kaleb Valdemar is part of the Midnight Dawn but believes they’re just some sort of new “drug gang from Magnimar.” If asked about Kanker, he grows fearful and quiet—just how much about the ghast he might reveal to the PCs is up to you, but try to err on the side of “mysterious and unnerving.” Aliver knows a little bit about the layout of the Cloneworks (areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}, the northern part of @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05lakeofthehol00]{F20}, and area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05templeofazat00]{F17}), and even less about the level below. If the PCs seem focused on trying to learn as much as they can about the Pit from Aliver, the Midnight Dawn might just send an intellect devourer from area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06midnightdawn00]{G7} into town one night to kill him.

In any event, Kaleb Valdemar has already relocated to the Pit at this point, so once the PCs learn of his connection to the Midnight Dawn, he won’t be around to interrogate—see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20002strang.JournalEntryPage.02investigatin00]{Investigating Kaleb Valdemar} for more details.

Reward: If the PCs expose Aliver Podiker and have him arrested, force him to flee into the deeper reaches of the Pit, or simply kill him, they prevent the third of Sandpoint’s seven dooms—grant them 120 XP for the achievement.

While Aliver Podiker wasn’t a well-liked local, he did have allies in town. If the PCs kill him, they lose 1 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20011sandpo.JournalEntryPage.11sandpointsfa00]{Reputation Point} with the Bunyip Club. In addition, if the PCs can’t prove that Podiker’s death was the result of self-defense on their part or that the alchemist had ill intent for the town, they’ll lose 5 Reputation Points with the Town Watch and 2 Reputation Points with the Sandpoint Mercantile League and the Townsfolk.

If the PCs do manage to expose what Podiker was really up to, though, and can prove it with the documents from Podiker’s basement, they gain 2 Reputation Points with the Sandpoint Mercantile League and the Townsfolk. If they turn Podiker over to the authorities, they also gain 2 Reputation Points with the Town Watch.

Ch 5: Shadows at Midnight.name: 第五章 午夜阴影 Ch 5: Shadows at Midnight

The Devil’s Sanctum.name: The Devil’s Sanctum
The Devil’s Sanctum.text:
The Devil’s Sanctum

Music NotesMusic

@UUID[Playlist.YHCeMbIzyQ6wPX5j.PlaylistSound.BpEFamOdPpZieXno]{The Devil’s Sanctum (loop)}, @UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.ugQkg6UoZtp5B9jD]{The Devil’s Sanctum}

The northern portion of this level is where the ancient caverns still sprawl—chambers connected to the Darklands that are now used as lairs for several competing monsters, as well as for the Midnight Dawn. These caverns connect to deeper chambers far below, and while they have a link to the Pit itself, the pit becomes more treacherous. Access is possible from the level above (via area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}) or below (via areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20007apatte.JournalEntryPage.07speakingcryp00]{H3}, @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20007apatte.JournalEntryPage.07stairwell00000]{H4}, or @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20007apatte.JournalEntryPage.07funguscourt000]{H7}). These caverns are unlit.

Until recently, undead remnants of the priests who once tended the partially completed demonic shrines of the southern chambers were the primary inhabitants, but when Jordus Munt discovered and made use of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.g1AeVS3yQULgJt9X]{Ghost Stone} (see area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20004footpr.JournalEntryPage.04theghostston00]{E10}), he learned of a chamber here whose properties enhanced the casting of ritual magic. He led several of his most powerful disciples into these chambers, defeated most of the undead, and has been spending his time preparing and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrating} the ritual chamber (area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06ritualchambe00]{G4}) for his masterwork—a ritual designed to bind his soul to that of the Sandpoint Devil and transform himself into something greater. When the PCs slew the Sandpoint Devil earlier in this adventure, Jordus sensed the loss—an experience that has only further convinced him that now is the time to finish this rite. Fortunately for the PCs, the complexity of this unique ritual means that it takes quite some time for Jordus Munt to complete it—there’s no need to track his progress, because regardless of how long it takes, the first time the PCs reach area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06ritualchambe00]{G4}, he’s close to finishing it off.

Sanctum Features.name: Sanctum Features
Sanctum Features.text:
Sanctum Features

The walls of the Devil’s Sanctum are of well-preserved worked stone, and are carved with prayers (in Abyssal) to various Abyssal demigods. In any of the chambers, a PC who can read Abyssal and takes 10 minutes to investigate the prayers can determine that this area was originally intended as a place of worship for the demon lords @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.bLI1JMpI2GXQT5AC]{Abraxas} (particularly in his role as a patron of forbidden magic), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.Y6tbAWlcccGlUH0z]{Haagenti} (in his capacity as a patron for invention), and Mestama (focusing on her association with deception), but also for the qlippoth lord Thuskchoon (for his role in the accidental revelation of long-forgotten secrets). As with previous areas in the Pit where ancient Thassilonian architecture persists, these chambers are lit by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ynm8JIU3sc3qUMpa] spells placed at the center of Sihedron runes placed semi-regularly in the ceiling, so that areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06templethresh00]{G1}–@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06hiddensanctu00]{G5} are all brightly lit. The Devil’s Disciples have hung several incense burners from pitons driven into the walls, so that all of these chambers stink of brimstone. Ceiling height averages 10 feet and doors are made of hewn stone.

Temple Threshold.name: Temple Threshold
Temple Threshold.text:
G1. Temple ThresholdLow 8

The northern door into this room from the Pit has been sealed with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr]{Lock} spell cast by Jordus Munt. A PC can make a @Check[athletics|dc:26|traits:attack,skill,action:force-open|name:Force Open] or @Check[thievery|dc:26|traits:manipulate,skill,action:pick-a-lock|name:Pick a Lock] check to Force Open the door or Pick the Lock respectively—or smash the door down (Core Rulebook 515).

The air in this large chamber smells of brimstone, likely from the numerous smoldering incense sticks that burn in holders hanging from pitons driven into the walls. Brighter flames flicker from star-shaped engravings on the ceiling, while the walls are covered with curving lines of unsettling-looking runes. Five stone pillars support the ceiling, and a cauldron filled with what smells like stew bubbles near one of the northern pillars. To the south, eight bedrolls are stretched out over thin mattresses of straw. Several boulders and bits of rubble have been stacked before a door to the south, possibly taken from the southwestern wall, which appears to have collapsed ages ago.

The new occupants of this chamber haven’t discovered the secret door in the west wall, which can be spotted with a successful @Check[perception|dc:24|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] check by a Seeking PC. The chamber beyond (area G1a) contains a single slab of black stone engraved with the Sihedron. This was yet another of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5ZW1w9f4gWlSIuWA]{Teleportation Circles} created eons ago by Liralarue. This one once led to a much larger temple to a demon lord located on a now-sunken isle not far from the southern shore of Lake Skotha in the Storval Plateau. This platform can be identified and utilized in the same way as those that appear in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20003whistl.JournalEntryPage.03spysworkshop00]{D15}.

Creatures: Once Jordus Munt decided to begin his ritual here, he brought all of his most powerful followers with him (save for his second, Asmerelli, who he left in charge of the rest of the cult above—see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20004footpr]{Chapter 4}). While Jordus spends most of his time in non-stop research and ritual performances now, these eight “Ascended” disciples are allowed to swap out every 8 hours, so at any one time, four of them are resting here while the other four are aiding him in the ritual chamber (area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06ritualchambe00]{G4}).

Temple Threshold Low 8

@UUID[Actor.xPulk95h3GxE1eZN]{Ascended Disciples (4)}

The four cultists stationed here are under strict orders to not interfere with the ritual—the only time they’re allowed to go beyond the western door is when the previous shift returns, exhausted. Faced with intruders, the four cultists here do their best to defeat the PCs, focusing on anyone they suspect might be trying to make their way to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06thewatchingl00]{G3}. The cultists fight to the death, but if they’re captured, they try to trick the PCs into exploring beyond the barricaded southern door. While the cultists placed boulders over this door to keep the undead in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06unfinishedch00]{G2} from coming to get them, they tell the PCs that they’ve imprisoned several sacrifices beyond the door, hoping to compel the PCs into a confrontation with the totenmaskes in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06unfinishedch00]{G2} rather than risk them heading toward area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06ritualchambe00]{G4}.

Unfinished Chambers.name: Unfinished Chambers
Unfinished Chambers.text:
G2. Unfinished ChambersLow 8

The walls of this unfinished chamber are rough, giving only a hint as to the nameless architect’s original plans for what may have been intended to be a barracks, a prison, or perhaps simply a maze of hallways. A horrific statue stands to the north—a figure vaguely appearing to be a mix of a winged bull standing on its hind feet and a reptilian-headed figure with snakes for legs. Even worse, the statue is sculpted not from stone or wood, but from the flesh of what appear to be at least three humans that have been reshaped and stretched over a creatively reassembled skeleton.

The unsettling statue was, until recently, a trio of Devil’s Disciples who fell victim to the undead guardians of this chamber. A PC who makes a successful@Check[religion|dc:20|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge recognizes this awful statue, which seems to combine features of the demon lords @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.bLI1JMpI2GXQT5AC]{Abraxas} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.Y6tbAWlcccGlUH0z]{Haagenti}. A critical success allows that PC to recall that totenmaskes can shape flesh, and often do so to create strange tableaus such as this.

Creatures: Once intended to be a place for the temple priests to relax, Liralarue never finished work here. When Earthfall struck, the two priests who had been gathered on site to speak about whether or not they should stay in the area or abandon it were overwhelmed with fear and awe at what they felt to be the end of the world. They made their way back into this chamber from the surface and argued about whether or not their demonic patrons had seen fit to end the world. The argument came to blows, and ultimately the two perished at each other’s hands.

The two zealots, infused with sins that would normally have ensured horrific transformations into demons had they made it to the Abyss, instead lingered here and became totenmaskes. They have forgotten much of their lives over the many centuries they’ve spent here in endless arguments over which of them made the error in their final ritual that doomed them to this forever unlife. The interruption of their argument by the Devil’s Disciples gave the two a much-needed break—now they’re arguing about which demon lord they should decide to settle on in creating this statue.

Both totenmaskes are currently in their living form, appearing as they did in life—as regal Thassilonian aristocrats dressed in mauve robes (although one of the two’s robes hangs in tatters). Upon spotting the PCs, they mistake them for more Devil’s Disciples. One of them steps forward and addresses the PCs in Thassilonian: “And so the infidels return. Tell us, before you join your brothers in our offering to the Abyss, who strikes you as a more appropriate inspiration for a requiem to all that has been lost? Surely it is Abraxas?” The other steps forward and adds, “Nonsense, Lord Haagenti is the obvious choice!”

Unfinished Chambers Low 8

@UUID[Actor.CEWwP34uXLd204Hj]{Totenmaskes (2)}

If the PCs understand the language, they can attempt a @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:concentrate,secret,action:sense-motive|name:Sense Motive]{Sense Motive} check to realize these two strange men seem to be asking for the PCs’ advice to solve an argument that is on the verge of coming to blows. A cunningly worded reply that plays each man’s beliefs against the other, along with a @Check[religion|dc:23] check, can push the two totenmaskes over the edge and trigger the long-brewing conflict between them, causing them to attack each other. In this event, the two undead fight each other until one is destroyed, at which point the survivor continues their violence unabated and attacks the party, only then finally abandoning its living form to reveal the awful truth.

Alternatively, the PCs could try to speak to them to learn a bit about the original purpose of the chamber—what they reveal about the history of the Pit is left to you, but it shouldn’t take long for them to grow impatient and attack. If the PCs don’t understand Thassilonian, the undead shrug when it becomes apparent that the PCs, like those who came before them, are simply “too ignorant to understand,” but since flesh needs no intellect to serve as a medium for art, no matter. The undead revert to their true forms to attack at once, hoping to secure more supplies so that they can build two statues instead of one. They fight until they are both destroyed, but do not pursue foes from this chamber.

Scene NotesMacro

@UUID[Macro.N93xcQflI3GEQxMB]{Totenmaske Form Reveal}

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.V48YF16Fz7ky6Npt]{Pile}
The gear from the three slain ascended disciples whose bodies were used to craft the hideous flesh sculpture lies discarded just north of the statue, consisting of three suits of studded leather armor, three +1 machetes, three composite shortbows, 60 arrows, and three religious symbols of the Devil’s Disciples.

The mauve robes worn by the totenmaskes were once both powerful magic items, but a previous fight left one of the garments ruined in tatters. The other remains a functioning greater cultist cowl, although the totenmaske who wears it no longer remembers how to activate it.

The Watching Lords.name: The Watching Lords
The Watching Lords.text:
G3. The Watching LordsLow 8

Stone statues of hideous monsters stand in alcoves along this long, ten-foot-wide hallway. From east to west, the statues depict a strange worm, a twisted hag, a winged bull, and a reptilian-faced man with snakes for legs. Each statue is a pair, looking across the hall at its own likeness from their alcoves.

A successful @Check[religion|dc:20|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge is enough to identify the three westernmost statues as depicting the demon lords Mestama, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.Y6tbAWlcccGlUH0z]{Haagenti}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.bLI1JMpI2GXQT5AC]{Abraxas}, but a PC can only recognize the more obscure fourth, Thuskchoon, on a critical success.

The Watching Lords Low 8

@UUID[Actor.SO1SVKmIf1MGZPTz]{The Watching Lords} @UUID[Actor.mLJKuz3MbSWRNWmO]{Brimoraks (4)}

Hazard: The statues in this hall are a still-functioning trap, the nature of which has gone completely unnoticed by the chaotic evil Devil’s Disciples who come and go through here with ease.

Ritual Chamber.name: Ritual Chamber
Ritual Chamber.text:
G4. Ritual ChamberSevere 8

Music NotesMusic

@UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.lKqOYREeS6vHB9QR]{The Cult}, @UUID[Playlist.YHCeMbIzyQ6wPX5j.PlaylistSound.RpJEJTVIVpRcWHSt]{Seven Dooms For Sandpoint (Loop)}, @UUID[Playlist.TmV0uKHOhpcz4zGF.PlaylistSound.TXRh1D5dUbWoTCLN]{Seven Dooms For Sandpoint}

This large chamber is well-lit by glowing flames in the ceiling. The walls are covered with lines of twisting runes. Two pillars support the fifteen-foot-high ceiling, while to the south, four more pillars surround a tiered set of steps that descend into a circular depression in the floor. The air in the room carries a haze from the numerous sticks of brimstone-smelling incense burning here and there in the chamber.

The secret door in the north wall can be discovered with a successful @Check[perception|dc:24|traits:concentrate,secret,action:seek|name:Seek] check by a Seeking PC.

Creatures: The leader of the Devil’s Disciples, Jordus Munt, leads four of his most devoted followers in a grueling ritual here, one intended to infuse Jordus with the power of the Sandpoint Devil (or if the PCs have already slain the creature, to reincarnate it into Jordus’ body). Jordus stands at the center of the circular area to the south with each of his four followers standing at the cardinal directions on the surrounding steps; they’re so intent on the chanting that they suffer a –2 circumstance penalty to initiative checks, unlike the two gargoyles standing guard to the north. Like those encountered in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20004footpr.JournalEntryPage.04thedevilsnes00]{E8}, these gargoyles have been altered to look like the Sandpoint Devil.

Ritual Chamber Severe 8

@UUID[Actor.jImEuKNqKdh4mWhT]{Jordus Munt} @UUID[Actor.xPulk95h3GxE1eZN]{Ascended Disciples (4) }@UUID[Actor.KYe1d6Q6441KKpqV]{Gargoyles (2)}

The cultists react with fury at having their ritual interrupted, but as long as they can defeat the PCs in a few minutes, the distraction won’t force Jordus to start over. As such, he spares no time for talking, instead ordering his followers to put down the intruders as quickly as possible. Jordus can’t leave his position at the center of the ritual circle without disrupting the mystical energies he’s built up, and relies upon his spells and Devil’s Cursed Breath to fight the PCs. The cultists fight to the death.

If Jordus Munt is slain, an unsettling thing occurs. As he takes his death blow, the man staggers back with a howl that bears an eerie resemblance to that of the Sandpoint Devil. A plume of smoke and ash billows up from his mouth, taking the brief form of the Sandpoint Devil before it whooshes away to the east, blasting through the complex to spiral down into the Pit below. A PC who witnesses this can attempt a @Check[occultism|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] or @Check[religion|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge to theorize that Jordus’s mid-ritual death transformed a portion of his soul into something more akin to that possessed by the Sandpoint Devil than that of a man.

Scene NotesAudio

@UUID[Playlist.vzeckNwf4xKCbBPz.PlaylistSound.uBd7EQDzh1ykXKkb]{Howl Of The Sandpoint Devil} @UUID[Macro.Nvj81l17o3oFOQGN]{Toggle Ritual Chanting}

Treasure: While Liralarue never finished this temple, she did complete the infusion of power into the ritual circle in the southern portion of this room. A PC who examines this area can deduce the powers of the ritual circle with a @Check[arcana|dc:29|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[nature|dc:29|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic], @Check[occultism|dc:29|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic] or @Check[religion|dc:29|traits:concentrate,exploration,secret,action:identify-magic|name:Identify Magic] check to Identify Magic. Any ritual performed within this circle grants the primary caster of the ritual a +2 item bonus to skill checks made to cast a ritual, and a +1 item bonus to skill checks made by secondary casters, provided the primary caster remains at the center of the circle for the duration of the ritual.

To Raise the Devil.name: To Raise the Devil
To Raise the Devil.text:
Chapter 6: To Raise the Devil

Below the Cloneworks, Liralarue intended to build a sprawling temple complex devoted to the various demon lords she drew inspiration from and planned on taking advantage of some larger caverns she discovered at this depth to do so. She hoped to draw upon some of the mysterious Abyssal energies infusing the area to foster a place that would facilitate the conjuration of demonic minions. Yet her interest in matters of faith never quite equaled her focus on cloning (see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow]{Chapter 5}), clockworks (see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20007apatte]{Chapter 7}), or her own pursuit of becoming the eighth runelord (see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20008wherec]{Chapter 8}) took precedence, and as such, she never quite finished this level’s construction. Most of the chambers remain as natural caverns, but their links to the Darklands have made it a sort of staging ground for many of the monsters that now dwell elsewhere in the Pit.

This level of the Pit is intended for 8th-level characters.

Hidden Sanctum.name: Hidden Sanctum
Hidden Sanctum.text:
G5. Hidden Sanctum

A semicircular stone shelf sits on each of this chamber’s walls, supporting a bronze bowl. Each bowl is filled with an unsettling liquid of a different color, and each sits before a stone statuette of a hideous monster. A desk and chair sit in the center of the room. What appears to be several religious texts lie stacked on the desk, while next to it on the floor is a folded bedroll and a bulging backpack.

This chamber served Liralarue as a private place for her to meditate, worship her four fiendish patrons, and work on her never-completed plans to build a grand temple to the Abyssal demigods here. The PCs can identify the four statues of her patrons here in the same way they could in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06thewatchingl00]{G3}.

Jordus Munt discovered this room not long ago, and spent some time preparing for his ritual here as well. The bulging pack on the floor next to his bedroll contains a few spare changes of clothes and enough rations to last another few weeks down here.

Treasure: @UUID[Actor.bZVLSpVBl9hcbDiC]{Hidden Sanctum}
The books kept here comprise a collection that’s 4 Bulk in all. They’re rare tomes, all written in Abyssal, alternately focusing on demonology or ritual magic. If used to aid in Investigation or Research on either of these topics, they grant a +1 item bonus to the check. A slim wand of telepathy made from bronze sits in one of the books as a bookmark. The collection is worth 60 gp in all. In addition, the books can be used to @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20012advent.JournalEntryPage.12researchingt00]{Research the Eighth Runelord}.

A smaller journal in Jordus’s pack contains a wealth of information chronicling his goals and beliefs, all written in Varisian. A PC who spends 4 hours studying this journal learns much about the Devil’s Disciples (feel free to fill the party in on any lingering questions they might still have about this group), including the initial plan to sacrifice victims to the Sandpoint Devil to encourage its apotheosis to godhood, and in the final few entries, Jordus’s frustration at the Sandpoint Devil’s untimely death and his desire to be transformed into a new Sandpoint Devil. A PC who studies these entries and makes a successful @Check[occultism|dc:26] check realizes that, if Jordus had been allowed to complete his ritual, he would have succeeded and become an even more powerful incarnation of the legendary monster. Fortunately (or unfortunately, depending on your take), these notes are too incomplete to allow anyone else to attempt the same ritual themselves.

Reward: Grant the PCs 40 XP for discovering this hidden chamber and its secrets.

Midnight Guardpost.name: Midnight Guardpost
Midnight Guardpost.text:
G6. Midnight GuardpostTrivial 8

A line of stalactites and stalagmites runs along the western side of this fifteen-foot-high cavern.

The stairs to the east of this area lead up to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20005shadow.JournalEntryPage.05deroambush0000]{F2}.

Creatures: This cavern at first seems unremarkable, but two alien spies lurk in hiding near the ceiling of the western wall amid the stalactites. These black, jellyfish-like entities are rhu-chaliks, spies normally employed as agents of the Dominion of the Black in the depths of space. While the intellect devourers of Ilvarandin have long ago abandoned their immediate ties to their kin among the Dominion, these creatures still retain tactics and resources used in those distant parts of reality.

These two rhu-chaliks serve Tiluatchek, and keep a watchful eye on who (and what) comes and goes through this passage. They maintain invisibility at all times to help in their operations, and do not attack if they spy the PCs moving through the area. Instead, the creatures watch silently, then quietly stalk the PCs wherever they travel, continuing to observe. Their hope is to keep following the PCs until they camp for the night, at which point the two aliens float into the camp to try to use Void Transmission to send details of sleeping PCs to Tiluatchek. While the intellect devourer is quite intelligent, even he cannot process the entirety of a creature’s consciousness in one instant (as can stranger receivers used by the Dominion of the Black in the depths of space), but this information is enough to give the intellect devourer a greater insight into the PCs’ capabilities and plans, beyond what he’s been able to deduce as Kaleb during the dinner at the Rusty Dragon. See area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20008wherec.JournalEntryPage.08tiluatcheksb00]{J8} in Chapter 8 for details of how Tiluatchek might take advantage of this information if he gains it.

Midnight Guardpost Trivial 8

@UUID[Actor.PWGt8koc1NaUAq6O]{Rhu-Chaliks (2)}

If the PCs spot the rhu-chaliks, the creatures attack, attempting to incapacitate foes with their excruciating enzymes. The aliens flee any fight if they are reduced to fewer than 25 Hit Points, but return here to area G6 after a few hours to take up their watch once more. If the rhu-chaliks are spotted by the PCs while they’re already engaged. In a fight, the creatures do not engage; instead, they back off to watch from afar to study their tactics. If the PCs win their combat, the two rhu-chaliks then swoop in to attempt to finish them off.

Midnight Dawn Encampment.name: Midnight Dawn Encampment
Midnight Dawn Encampment.text:
G7. Midnight Dawn EncampmentSevere 8

This large cavern smells of spices and cooking meat, likely coming from the fire pit over which a spider the size of a hound slowly roasts on a spit. Several water barrels and wooden crates sit against the northern walls. What look like child-sized bedrolls lie in three alcoves, while to the southeast, a strangely smooth stone wall almost—but not quite—blocks a passageway leading further east.

The barrels and crates contain supplies—mostly food and water. Among the food is a wide range of spices, sweets, and savory preserves. The passage to the south leads to a flight of stairs that leads down to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20007apatte.JournalEntryPage.07stairwell00000]{H4}. The stone wall nearby that blocks access to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06webchokedcav00]{G8} is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kOa055FIrO9Smnya]{Wall of Stone} that was placed here by Tiluatchek to prevent enemies from the Darklands from having easy access to this cavern; it must be smashed apart if the PCs want to move beyond it into area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap20006torais.JournalEntryPage.06webchokedcav00]{G8}.

Scene NotesMacro

@UUID[Macro.nESNaWzxua96ZpvM]{Destroy Wall of Stone}
